name: kgentop

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wcel(c0, ctop))
-| wss(crn(ckgen), ctop)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wcel(c0, ctop))
-| wss(crn(ckgen), ctop)

body.origin:
|- wss(crn(ckgen), ctop)
-| wf(ckgen, ctop, ctop)
-| wi(wf(ckgen, ctop, ctop), wss(crn(ckgen), ctop))
body.pretty:
⊢ ran(kGen)⊆ Top
⊣ (kGen : Top → Top)
⊣ ((kGen : Top → Top)→ ran(kGen)⊆ Top)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wcel(c0, ctop))
-| wf(ckgen, ctop, ctop)
-| wi(wf(ckgen, ctop, ctop), wss(crn(ckgen), ctop))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ ran(kGen)→ c0 ∈ Top)
⊣ (kGen : Top → Top)
⊣ ((kGen : Top → Top)→ ran(kGen)⊆ Top)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wcel(c0, ctop))
-| wi(wf(ckgen, ctop, ctop), wss(crn(ckgen), ctop))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ ran(kGen)→ c0 ∈ Top)
⊣ ((kGen : Top → Top)→ ran(kGen)⊆ Top)

comment: A compactly generated space is a topology. (Note: henceforth we will use the idiom " ` J e. ran kGen ` " to denote " ` J ` is compactly generated", since as we will show a space is compactly generated iff it is in the range of the compact generator.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Mar-2015.)
